result.execSummary:
All charges against Bryant O'Neil Scott in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bryant O'Neil Scott is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Court dismissed for lack of probable cause

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryant O'Neil Scott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott in Court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Motion hearing. Court reviewed State's Motion for Leave to Amend Information. Statements made by the parties. Defense moved to dismiss. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Dismiss. Court ordered case DISMISSED WITHOUT PREJUDICE. Defendant released from all conditions of Bail. State advised the Court that case will be re-issued. Parties pre-selected an Initial Appearance date in OCCR.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott in court with attorney Arial Rosenberg.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bryant O'Neil Scott appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense is requesting additional time to review discovery. State is requesting a motion hearing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD.
State's Motion for Leave to Amend Information.

Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior OWI convictions. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer J. Cooper.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case recalled. Attorney Darryl Smith has been appointed to represent Mr. Scott. The indigency hearing of 3/31/22 at 1:30pm is vacated. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Indigency hearing on March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-25-2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bryant O'Neil Scott appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. AS TO COUNT 2:  Motion to dismiss by the defense for lack of probable cause, argued and GRANTED by the Court. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.    DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
